intro: Pariti abutiloides, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense, velvety pubescence. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in clusters. It is native to regions of South America and thrives in warm, humid climates. Pariti abutiloides is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and floral display.
